title: With Threats to Greenland, Trump Sets America on the Road to Conquest
summary: After a century of defending other countries against foreign aggression, the United States is now positioned as an imperial power trying to seize another nation’s land.

title: Trump Links His Push for Greenland to Not Winning Nobel Peace Prize
summary: In a text, President Trump told Norway’s prime minister that he no longer felt obliged to “think purely of Peace” and that the U.S. needed the island for global security.

title: One Year in Trump’s America, and the Fed’s Big Moment at the Supreme Court
summary: Plus, the struggle to finish a major Olympic arena.

title: Trump’s First Year Could Have Lasting Economic Consequences
summary: President Trump’s policies have so far done little to change the overall state of the American economy, but economists warn they will ultimately weaken the United States.

title: How Trump Flexes Power in White House Meetings With Zelensky and Others
summary: With cameras rolling, President Trump met with more than 40 international leaders in his first year back in office.

title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Misleading Claims After One Year Back in Office
summary: The president has justified many significant moves of his second term with inaccurate claims and overstated boasts.

title: Trump 2.0: A Year of Unconstrained Power
summary: A round-table discussion of President Trump’s first year back in office.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Case Testing Limits of Hawaii Gun Law
summary: The justices will hear arguments over whether a Hawaii law that imposes restrictions on carrying concealed weapons violates the Second Amendment.

title: Federal Reserve Inquiry Clouds Trump’s Supreme Court Bid to Oust Lisa Cook
summary: The court is set to hear Ms. Cook’s case challenging her firing as the Justice Department investigates Jerome H. Powell, the central bank chair.

title: Netflix Revamps Its Warner Bros. Bid, Seeking to Thwart Paramount
summary: Netflix will pay all cash for the $83 billion deal to acquire major parts of Warner Bros. Discovery, instead of a mix of cash and stock.

title: Volunteers in Minnesota Deliver Groceries So Immigrants Can Hide at Home
summary: Thousands of Minneapolis residents have joined a church-run effort to deliver donated groceries to immigrant families who fear being caught in public by federal agents.

title: Judge Allows Policy Restricting Lawmakers’ Access to ICE Facilities
summary: The decision permitted the Trump administration to continue restricting inspections of the conditions inside immigration detention compounds.

title: Trump Administration Asks Judge to Reject Minnesota’s Call to Block ICE Surge
summary: Lawyers for the state and the cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul have sued over the deployment of some 3,000 federal agents to Minnesota.

title: A Venezuelan Political Prisoner Finally Comes Home
summary: Ángel Godoy was thrown into jail after writing columns that angered the government of President Nicolás Maduro. Now his family is trying to make up for lost time.

title: As Spain Mourns Train Crash Victims, Investigators Focus on Track
summary: Officials on Tuesday were struggling to identify bodies from the crash near the southern city of Córdoba, which killed at least 41 people.

title: The Chinese Island Where Dreams of Real Estate Glory Never Die
summary: Intended as China’s version of Dubai’s palm-shaped artificial island, Ocean Flower Island is a $12 billion monument to debt-fueled economic excess.

title: In the World of Weight Loss, the Calorie No Longer Counts
summary: Long held up as the big benchmark of nutrition, the calorie is losing its clout in the age of GLP-1s and a sharper focus on nutrients.

title: Mikie Sherrill to Be Sworn In as Governor in New Jersey
summary: Ms. Sherrill beat a Republican endorsed by President Trump and did what no politician in New Jersey has done since 1961: win her party a third consecutive term in the governor’s office.

title: As Mamdani Focuses on Child Care, Plan to Tax the Rich Is Put Aside
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani campaigned on a proposal to increase taxes on those earning more than $1 million. For now, at least, he isn’t pushing.

title: Suicides Were Frequent at the Golden Gate Bridge. Not Anymore.
summary: For decades, there had been an average of 30 each year. With a new deterrent in place, there were none in the second half of 2025.

title: 2026 Oscar Nomination Predictions
summary: “Sinners” and “One Battle After Another” could set a record. Expect them to be up for best picture with “Hamnet,” “Frankenstein” and “Marty Supreme.”

title: Trump Is the Ultimate Davos Man
summary: The annual conference for the elite, like everything else, is changing.

title: Jimmy Fallon Teases Trump Over Secondhand Prize
summary: The “Tonight Show” host joked that President Trump hung his new Nobel Prize on the wall “right next to his McDonald’s customer of the month plaque.”

title: An A.I. Start-Up Says It Wants to Empower Workers, Not Replace Them
summary: Founded by researchers from Anthropic, Google and xAI, the new company, Humans&, is already valued at $4.48 billion.

title: Death Toll Rises in Guatemalan Gang Riots
summary: Uprisings in three prisons have killed 10 police officers, presenting another challenge for President Bernardo Arévalo in his fight against corruption and organized crime.

title: Valentino Garavani, Regal Designer and Fashion’s ‘Last Emperor,’ Dies at 93
summary: Valentino, as he was called, created one of the most durable and fashionable labels and became an equal of his high society customers.

title: After Four Shark Attacks in 48 Hours, Australia Shuts Dozens of Beaches
summary: Many of the closed beaches were in Sydney, the site of three of the attacks.
